Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which people in Washington, New York, and Los Angeles ignored the opioid epidemic in Butler.
Understate: The claim may understate the efforts made by the Obama administration to tackle prescription drug abuse.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in acknowledging that awareness of opioid addiction spread widely beyond urban areas.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that leaders in Washington or large cities on the East and West coasts hate people in smaller cities and towns beset by opioid addiction.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why people in Washington, New York, or Los Angeles did not address the opioid epidemic in Butler.
